Know, identify in the New Testament, and explain the
Sorrowful Mysteries:  Agony in the Garden, Scourging at the Pillar, Crowing with Thorns, Carrying the Cross, Crucifixion and Death.

Liturgical Rites:  Weddings, Funerals, and

Find evidence of anointing and healing in the New
Testament.

Locate a New Testament passage that describes the
Sacraments of Initiation.

E4B0E30A85BE4FAAB918A5AC4B12E0F5.description: Articulate as a statement in the creeds the belief in the Trinity, the One God of the Old and New Testament, Father, as the creator of all; Jesus, as living, dying and rising to save us from our sins, and the Holy Spirit as the ongoing presence of God living in the Church and each of us.

1A4137A85B11458393499029E2EC7344.description: Recognize the statement, “He descended into hell,” confesses that Jesus did really die and through his death for us conquered death and the devil “who has the power of death” (Heb 2:14).

6AF47DDC055045D583AA6B0737B5EA27.description: Begin to recognize we can know characteristics of God, but our understanding of God will always be limited as our human words can never explain the mystery of God.

Articulate that the central mystery of the Christian faith is the
Holy Trinity, Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

Trace and compare the stories of the life, death, and
Resurrection of Jesus found in the Synoptic Gospels.

Explain the meaning of “synoptic” and how the synoptic

0E297A80BF604549803F628FF3FF25D5.description: List the twenty-seven books in the New Testament and where to find them.

6C731C49AA174BE08764168B3D6AFBA5.description: Locate and cite passages in the New Testament that highlight God’s desire to reveal Himself to us.
